channel.title: Ctf on elmosalamy | blog
channel.description: Recent content in Ctf on elmosalamy | blog

item.title: [Web] Novacore: A Never-ending Chain (HTB Business CTF)
item.description: Novacore was an extremely well-designed web security challenge that appeared in Hack the Box’s Global Cyber Skills Benchmark CTF 2025 where companies like Microsoft, Cisco, Intel, Deloitte and KPMG showcased their cybersecurity talents in a one-of-a-kind business CTF.

item.title: HTB Cyber Apocalypse 2025 Writeup - All Web
item.description: This year saw a significant improvement to PwnSec’s performance. We moved from 77th last year to achieving 15th this year.

item.title: Hack My Bot Writeup for Beginners (PwnMe 2025 CTF)
item.description: Hey! Today we will be exploring Hack My Bot 1 and 2 together, a lovely 2-part web challenge that came up in the recent PwnMe 2025 CTF and had ~11 solves towards the end of the competition.

item.title: UofT 2025 CTF (Web)
item.description: UofT CTF 2025 hosted by University of Toronto was a blast. I played with my team PwnSec and we ranked 33 despite missing out three categories.

item.title: Google CTF 2024 Grand Prix Heaven
item.description: This is my solution for Grand Prix Heaven from Google 2024 CTF. I particularly enjoyed this challenge because of its detail level; multiple little vulnerabilities had to be chained together to achieve XSS on the target.

item.title: "Bad" - Arab Security War Games 2024
item.description: In this writeup, I will explain how I solved Bad, an interesting web challenge written by the amazing Abdelhamid Ghazy as part of the recent Arab Security Conference War Games (ASCWG) 2024.

item.title: BOM Sniffing to XSS
item.description: In this post, we will learn about text encoding, how browsers determine content encoding, talk about BOM and finally how we can bypass DOM sanitizers by just playing around with input encoding.

item.title: Apexsurvive Writeup (HTB Cyber Apocalypse 2024)
item.description: Update: This writeup won 1st place in Hack The Box Writeup Competition Update 2: I mentioned a research paper that helped me solve this challenge by James Kettle.

item.title: Google CTF 2023 And How It Almost Backfired
item.description: I wanted to introduce a group of students to cybersecurity. They showed passion and willingness to learn. I thought there would be no better introduction than inviting them to a Capture the Flag (CTF) competition.
